definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: That way, they wouldn’t have to worry about encountering poachers and other dangerous humans.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就不必擔心他們遭遇偷獵者和其他危險分子了。

sentences.english: The confrontation with poachers brought troubles.
sentences.chinese: 與偷獵者的對抗也帶來了麻煩。

sentences.english: Sometimes poachers are killed and occasionally scouts have been killed.
sentences.chinese: 有時是偷獵者被殺死，也有巡防隊員被害的情況發生。

sentences.english: Turtles caught in fishing nets were sold to poachers.
sentences.chinese: 海龜陷入漁網，被出售給偷獵者。

sentences.english: This was probably the work of a poacher.
sentences.chinese: 這很可能是一個偷獵者乾的。

sentences.english: And actually, what Gelute and its colleague do so is the livelihood of poacher.
sentences.chinese: 而實際上，格魯特及其同僚原來做的是偷獵者的營生。

sentences.english: The Heights were Heathcliff's land, and he was reproving the poacher.
sentences.chinese: 山莊是希刺克厲夫的土地，他在斥責着這個偷獵者。

sentences.english: He thinks it is likely that much was seized from poaching.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲大部分象牙很可能是從偷獵者那裏沒收來的。

sentences.english: Poachers are believed to have killed Sita in 2000.
sentences.chinese: 人們相信斯塔在2000年被偷獵者捕殺。

sentences.english: People gather around the disfigured bodies of vicunas that were allegedly killed by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 人們聚集在被偷獵者非法獵殺的駱馬屍體周圍。

sentences.english: The paws come from bears killed legally by hunters and also by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 這些熊掌不僅來自合法獵手捕殺的熊，也來自偷獵者。

sentences.english: An old poacher makes the best keeper.
sentences.chinese: 老偷獵者是最好的看管人。
